keyword: how many calories burned in hot yoga
title: How Many Calories Burned in Hot Yoga?
meta_description: Discover how many calories burned in hot yoga per session, including factors like duration, intensity, body weight, and tips for accurate tracking.
h1: How Many Calories Burned in Hot Yoga?
assumptions: 60-minute session at moderate intensity for a 70 kg (155 lb) person; Bikram-style in a heated room (105°F/40°C); no prior experience adjustment.
disclaimer: Calories burned vary by body weight, fitness level, session length, humidity, and individual metabolism. Use a fitness tracker for personalized estimates.

quick_answer.text: A typical 60-minute hot yoga session burns about 400 calories for an average adult.

label_note: Values focus on energy expenditure; macronutrients are not applicable for exercise tracking.

tweaks.label: For a 90 kg (200 lb) person (higher weight increases burn)

faqs.q: How many calories burned in hot yoga for 60 minutes?
faqs.a: Approximately 400 kcal for a 70 kg person at moderate intensity.

faqs.q: Does body weight affect calories burned in hot yoga?
faqs.a: Yes—higher weight burns more; e.g., 90 kg person may burn 500 kcal per session.

faqs.q: Is hot yoga better for calorie burn than regular yoga?
faqs.a: Yes, the heat increases heart rate and sweat, boosting burn by 20-30% over standard yoga.

faqs.q: How to calculate personal calories burned in hot yoga?
faqs.a: Use MET value (about 5-7 for hot yoga) × weight in kg × duration in hours; apps like MyFitnessPal help.

faqs.q: What factors increase calories burned in hot yoga?
faqs.a: Longer sessions, higher intensity poses, greater body weight, and experience level all contribute.
